Last week, I voted to pass the bipartisan Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Assault and Sexual Harassment Act. This law would allow survivors to resolve their claims in a court of law and restore access to justice for those who are currently unable to seek accountability.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will grow American manufacturing, increase our nation‚Äôs ability to compete, and strengthen the supply chain. This legislation will bolster our regional economies by creating & sustaining jobs and ensuring goods are made right here in the United States.

Adam Clayton Powell Jr. was the first African-American to be elected to Congress from New York, and the first from any state in the Northeast.¬†He went on to serve for more than two decades and was a strong advocate for civil rights and justice for all. #BlackHistoryMonth

Last week, I voted to pass the bipartisan #PostalServiceReformAct to improve mail delivery & strengthen the @USPS. From delivering paychecks, to medications, to tax forms, the Postal Service plays a key role in our lives. I will keep working to advance this commonsense bill.

"We would like to thank Congressman Delgado, Secretary Austin, and all of those who made our dream to see our brother, Charles Johnson receive the Medal of Honor a reality."

"Even as a child, Charlie‚Äôs kindness, generosity, and integrity touched everyone that he met. Despite our grief, we were not surprised that he would give his life to save others. The best heroes are ordinary people who accomplish extraordinary deeds."

"We have grieved the death of our extraordinary brother every day for nearly 70 years, hoping that someday his remarkable act of selflessness, patriotism, and courage would be fully honored and recognized."

Please read these words from Charlie Johnson's remaining siblings:
 
"Our extraordinary brother Charlie 'Buddy' Johnson died as he had lived - thinking of others before himself."

Charlie Johnson was killed in action on June 12, 1953 while defending Outpost Harry. During the battle, Johnson ignored his own injuries and treated soldiers/dragged others to safety. He saved the lives of at least 8 men.
